data.product_description: Net-Results makes it easy for you to automate all kinds of marketing tasks. You end up getting more done in less time while doing a much better job nurturing your prospects, uncovering qualified leads and driving revenue growth.We compete head to head with Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot, Act-On, and Hubspot, every day. But what sets us apart is the Net-Results experience.Execute on your digital marketing strategy with the features and technical flexibility you need. Automate your actions, engage your prospects, convert customers, and integrate with your favorite apps -- all with leading segmentation capabilities. You won't be nickel and dimed for additional marketing automation users or CRM integrations.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 40 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 30 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: Based on 27 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: Based on 40 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 32 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 37 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Based on 18 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Based on 14 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Based on 45 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Based on 70 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Based on 71 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Based on 70 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Based on 62 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Based on 55 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Based on 45 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Based on 45 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Based on 53 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Search Tracking and Optimization
features.content: Based on 44 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track performance of keywords and links in major search engines.  Measure search rankings and performance.  Improve page-level SEO with tools to diagnose and improve page performance.  Integrate with Google AdWords.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: Based on 62 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Based on 60 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Based on 68 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Based on 57 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Based on 58 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Based on 61 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: Based on 52 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Based on 54 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Based on 50 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: Based on 34 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Based on 11 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR.

features.name: Budgeting
features.content: Manage all aspects of marketing investments, including assigning top-down budgets to various groups and divisions, planning marketing spending across programs, tracking open-to-spend, ensuring budget compliance, coordinating work-flows and permissions, and reconciling plans with actual invoices.

features.name: Social Listening
features.content: As reported in 14 Net-Results reviews. Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities.  Incorporate into your lead and customer DB and use social insights to segment prospects.  Trigger campaigns, and update lead scores.

features.name: Social Sharing
features.content: Based on 19 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Add intelligent social share buttons to your campaigns and content.  Track who is sharing your content and driving conversions.

features.name: Social Campaigns
features.content: Based on 20 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Schedule automated posts to one or more social accounts; use or integrate with URL shortening services; and measure likes, comments, replies, and retweets.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Based on 17 Net-Results reviews. Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Based on 12 Net-Results reviews. Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: Based on 71 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Based on 57 Net-Results reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity.

features.name: ROI Analytics
features.content: Measure leads, prospects generated, pipeline, revenue, investment, and ROI by marketing channel or program. The result is that you can see which marketing investments are generating the greatest return and get visibility into how marketing budget should be allocated going forward. 11 reviewers of Net-Results have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Revenue Analytics
features.content: Based on 10 Net-Results reviews. Analyze how leads flow through the funnel by measuring stage to stage conversion rates and velocity.  Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: SEO / Keyword Analytics
features.content: Monitor and track how you rank for relevant keywords on major search engines and compare your overall performance to competitors. This feature was mentioned in 10 Net-Results reviews.

initial_reviews.review_title: Cannot beat the customer service with this platform
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
The platform is intuitive and it has incredible staff behind it, both in customer service and in their development department; every conversation we have leaves me feeling motivated for what's coming next or returning to my current project with a new perspective

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
nothing comes to mind - everything is good

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We work for several clients in the foodservice industry with vastly different segmentation elements; the email builder tool is incredibly intuitive and effective but for me, the big win is in the data management capabilities I have relative to collecting info, tracking engagement behavior and automation of things, relative to marketing. In addition to our email marketing program, we've begun using it as a step below a full CRM tool which has in turn really advanced our options with targeting and personalization in the emails.  We can also quickly see things that may or may not be worth our time in terms of adding to our email schedule

initial_reviews.review_title: Great, customizable marketing solution with seamless integrations
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Net-results is a great tool to supplement your marketing and sales efforts. With seamless integration with salesforce, you can now get awesome insights about your leads directly in your salesforce widget (email and web activity). We primarily use for email marketing and monitoring site activity but also frequently use the reporting and segment tools which give so much valuable information. Support staff is also fantastic!

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
The email builder could be a bit better -- sometimes a little buggy and wonky with formatting. Other than that, I have no other negative feedback as any problems I have are always addressed quickly by staff.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Net-results gives me a way to view real-time web and email activity for contacts or leads we are currently pursuing, something we did not have access to before. We also have an easy way to manage our full database of contacts that allows me to stay out of Salesforce as much as possible.

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy Onboarding, but Shallow with Integration Bugs
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
You can stand up an email campaign very quickly. A/B, Drip, and Nurture sequences are very simple to stand up, and the email creation features also enable you to create attractive templates quickly.

Reporting-wise, custom segmentation reports are also fairly easy to generate, provided you keep your segments well-defined and organized. I do appreciate (when it works properly) that the Salesforce integration enables you to look at contacts' behavior history in a specialized tab within Salesforce, enabling accurate lead attribution.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
It's impossible to look for a specific contact - the lack of a contact search feature is glaring.

Regarding the Salesforce integration, it breaks *very* frequently and has significant bugs, requiring you to contact their client service often to rectify them. One bug is when you convert a lead to a SQL/Opportunity, the user activity history tab erases itself, which is frustrating when Sales converts a lead before you can attribute it.

Net-Results also lacks a lot of the more robust lead scoring, workflow management, and reporting capabilities of higher-tier, more expensive systems like Marketo and Hubspot. If you need a simple tool for email marketing and basic lead attribution, it's fine, but what you pay for is what you get.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing and supplemental data on lead reporting. It's a very basic tool but when working properly with Salesforce, it handles marketing to sales handoffs very well.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great automation platform! Excellent account & support teams that are accessible and helpful!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
We have worked with Net-Results for years and it has changed the way we communicate with our customers and provide leads to our sales team. Their pricing is great for the capabilities of the platform and the team that you have access to. Overall, it is user friendly for beginners but has the complexity for advanced users and as our team has progressed in our utilization of the platform. The support team at NR is also exceptional! They are accessible and helpful in problem solving and also recommending solutions or new ideas.  Net-Results has been a great company to work with and very accommodating as our business shifts and grows. We would highly recommend them if you are looking for a high-powered, cost-effective marketing automation platform with access to a great team behind it.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Overall, the platform is great so we can't say there are dislikes but perhaps a few program features that it would be nice to have added in. For example, once a campaign is active, you cannot change an  email in the series when you pause a campaign. You must make sure to build 'placeholders' if you don't have the content created yet. Also, you cannot mix nurture and drip emails into one campaign. It would be great to be able to include a mixture of these based on the actions the contact is taking. We also work across multiple time zones and when trying to manage specific time sends in nurture campaigns, a time zone feature would be beneficial in the actions tab to make sure things send at the correct time.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Highly Recommend!

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our team has been able to be more effectively integrated into our sales process in lead generation, tracking, and hand off - and we have a lot of features we are still learning and working to integrate!

initial_reviews.review_title: Simple, helpful and just what we needed
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
The best thing about Net-Results is their support department.  We moved over from a different platform and they're support team is 100x better than what we had previously.  It's a night and day difference.  They are incredibly responsive and we've even had situations where we say, "we need it to do this" and within a month, that feature was implemented.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
There isn't much to dislike, but they are a smaller company, so that might be an issue for some.  Not everything you expect from a bigger solution is built here yet, but they are getting there.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Make sure your CRM system has clean, good data before implementing.  This will make the system work the best and the data push pretty seamless.  If you have a lot of old, inactive records it can confuse the system.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
This solved a big cost problem for us.  We were overpaying with our old solution (about $80k per year).  This was much more manageable and much simpler to implement/use.  We realized that a lot of reasons we had purchased the old solution, in the end didn't matter and we didn't use them the way we thought we would.  Finding a solution that was easier to use made work much more enjoyable.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Net-Results is simple and handles the basics well. The sales and support teams are unparalleled! They gave me a very long free trial that helped me determine if Net-Results was going to suit my needs. During that time, there was no pressure from the Sales team. Once we did decide to purchase, the Support staff jumped right on board to answer all my questions (there are still a ton).

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
I don't know how long Net-Results has been around, but this feels like a new product. Most of the functionality you'd ever want is there, but there are some more nuanced features and tracking abilities that are missing. Net-Results has a solid team and solid product, but I feel like they still have some catching up to do before they can compete with the likes of Pardot (where I got most of my experience). You can do most of what you need to, but sometimes there are funky workarounds. I should note that we use MSCRM, so some of my comments are influenced by limitations with their approach to integration.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Net-Results has empowered us to track prospects on the web, more easily capture prospect information, and product intelligent follow-ups to those leads.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy Onboarding, but Shallow with Integration Bugs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
You can stand up an email campaign very quickly. A/B, Drip, and Nurture sequences are very simple to stand up, and the email creation features also enable you to create attractive templates quickly.

Reporting-wise, custom segmentation reports are also fairly easy to generate, provided you keep your segments well-defined and organized. I do appreciate (when it works properly) that the Salesforce integration enables you to look at contacts' behavior history in a specialized tab within Salesforce, enabling accurate lead attribution.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
It's impossible to look for a specific contact - the lack of a contact search feature is glaring.

Regarding the Salesforce integration, it breaks *very* frequently and has significant bugs, requiring you to contact their client service often to rectify them. One bug is when you convert a lead to a SQL/Opportunity, the user activity history tab erases itself, which is frustrating when Sales converts a lead before you can attribute it.

Net-Results also lacks a lot of the more robust lead scoring, workflow management, and reporting capabilities of higher-tier, more expensive systems like Marketo and Hubspot. If you need a simple tool for email marketing and basic lead attribution, it's fine, but what you pay for is what you get.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing and supplemental data on lead reporting. It's a very basic tool but when working properly with Salesforce, it handles marketing to sales handoffs very well.

all_reviews.review_title: Great automation platform! Excellent account & support teams that are accessible and helpful!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
We have worked with Net-Results for years and it has changed the way we communicate with our customers and provide leads to our sales team. Their pricing is great for the capabilities of the platform and the team that you have access to. Overall, it is user friendly for beginners but has the complexity for advanced users and as our team has progressed in our utilization of the platform. The support team at NR is also exceptional! They are accessible and helpful in problem solving and also recommending solutions or new ideas.  Net-Results has been a great company to work with and very accommodating as our business shifts and grows. We would highly recommend them if you are looking for a high-powered, cost-effective marketing automation platform with access to a great team behind it.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Overall, the platform is great so we can't say there are dislikes but perhaps a few program features that it would be nice to have added in. For example, once a campaign is active, you cannot change an  email in the series when you pause a campaign. You must make sure to build 'placeholders' if you don't have the content created yet. Also, you cannot mix nurture and drip emails into one campaign. It would be great to be able to include a mixture of these based on the actions the contact is taking. We also work across multiple time zones and when trying to manage specific time sends in nurture campaigns, a time zone feature would be beneficial in the actions tab to make sure things send at the correct time.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Highly Recommend!

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our team has been able to be more effectively integrated into our sales process in lead generation, tracking, and hand off - and we have a lot of features we are still learning and working to integrate!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
The best thing about Net-Results is their support department.  We moved over from a different platform and they're support team is 100x better than what we had previously.  It's a night and day difference.  They are incredibly responsive and we've even had situations where we say, "we need it to do this" and within a month, that feature was implemented.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
There isn't much to dislike, but they are a smaller company, so that might be an issue for some.  Not everything you expect from a bigger solution is built here yet, but they are getting there.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Make sure your CRM system has clean, good data before implementing.  This will make the system work the best and the data push pretty seamless.  If you have a lot of old, inactive records it can confuse the system.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
This solved a big cost problem for us.  We were overpaying with our old solution (about $80k per year).  This was much more manageable and much simpler to implement/use.  We realized that a lot of reasons we had purchased the old solution, in the end didn't matter and we didn't use them the way we thought we would.  Finding a solution that was easier to use made work much more enjoyable.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Net-Results is simple and handles the basics well. The sales and support teams are unparalleled! They gave me a very long free trial that helped me determine if Net-Results was going to suit my needs. During that time, there was no pressure from the Sales team. Once we did decide to purchase, the Support staff jumped right on board to answer all my questions (there are still a ton).

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
I don't know how long Net-Results has been around, but this feels like a new product. Most of the functionality you'd ever want is there, but there are some more nuanced features and tracking abilities that are missing. Net-Results has a solid team and solid product, but I feel like they still have some catching up to do before they can compete with the likes of Pardot (where I got most of my experience). You can do most of what you need to, but sometimes there are funky workarounds. I should note that we use MSCRM, so some of my comments are influenced by limitations with their approach to integration.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Net-Results has empowered us to track prospects on the web, more easily capture prospect information, and product intelligent follow-ups to those leads.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Net-Results?
review_question_answers.answer: Net-Results is simple and handles the basics well. The sales and support teams are unparalleled! They gave me a very long free trial that helped me determine if Net-Results was going to suit my needs. During that time, there was no pressure from the Sales team. Once we did decide to purchase, the Support staff jumped right on board to answer all my questions (there are still a ton).

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Net-Results?
review_question_answers.answer: I don't know how long Net-Results has been around, but this feels like a new product. Most of the functionality you'd ever want is there, but there are some more nuanced features and tracking abilities that are missing. Net-Results has a solid team and solid product, but I feel like they still have some catching up to do before they can compete with the likes of Pardot (where I got most of my experience). You can do most of what you need to, but sometimes there are funky workarounds. I should note that we use MSCRM, so some of my comments are influenced by limitations with their approach to integration.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Net-Results has empowered us to track prospects on the web, more easily capture prospect information, and product intelligent follow-ups to those leads.

all_reviews.review_title: Comprehensive Market Automation product you can grow into
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
By far - the best feature of their platform is their support. Hands down the most important factor when we considered other platforms like Marketo, Pardot and HubSpot since they upcharge much of their training and functionality. My ramp up time to get campaigns up and running plus integration with Salesforce was a breeze because I have access to my Net-Results dedicated developer support team member's calendar! Anytime - I can schedule a call, do a Go-To and never an additional cost. I just completed one email campaign with one of our companies and we generated one type of lead once converted, will pay for the cost of Net-Results.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
To early to tell. One thing I do like is their open communication about platform improvement suggestions from their customers. Too me, that means a nimble development environment where "in the field" improvements can be implemented quickly.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Go for it. I'm a seasoned digital manager, hands on with over 20 years experience and I can tell you, the difficulty I had with my previous Market Automation tool, Click Dimensions - was a complete nightmare. My experience only allowed me to try and troubleshoot problems.

Net-Results is so intuitive it will allow me to create the best methods of reaching my internal clients - Sales Managers - prospects and customers to provide the best information and expertise. Gauging the quality of contacts too is a breezes to calculate those that will convert once in the sales funnel.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
More sophisticated lead gen with entry into Salesforce. Better understanding of lead scoring and payoff. Dynamic landing pages allows robust product promotion or expertise training to prospects. Soon I will be using their data storage to test their .pdf download reporting from literature on my site - which I know will save time and money vs developing metrics in-house.

all_reviews.review_title: Take Control of Your Outbound & Inbound Marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
1st off, Net-Results provides a simple but powerful Divi tool to generate highly customizable email & landing pages. Building CTAs is a snap. There's no need to pay hidden or additional fees to get work designed your way. Your only limitation is your imagination.
2nd, forms are pretty simple to build that can be inserted into landing pages, with triggers for pop up notifications, emails, or landing pages. You can send emails with links to landing pages having forms to capture more information on prospective clients. You can easily do this to conduct surveys to learn more about your client's needs and interests.
3rd, both drip and nurture campaigns can be created, with you creating logical, easy to understand campaign flows. Your campaign needs can be met, whether they are simple, or extremely complex.
4th,  all customers receive the same, robust toolset and 10K of contacts before there are any increases in charges based on contacts. That means small firms (like mine) have the same capabilities as very large clients. That's incredible.
5th, service doesn't end (like some other firms). Service is available for your entire contract life. If you have a need to learn something new about the software, you call or email requesting a session. Time slot options are provided via a Calendly scheduling tool if some extensive training is desired. That doesn't prevent you getting an immediate answer to a simple question over the phone during business hours.
Every request for service assistance I've had from starting back in Jan 2016 to date has always been handled by a professional, pleasant, and very capable representative.
6th, reportage can be designed to feed you campaign information at regular intervals, meeting your needs.
7th, an asset database module is included, to organize and store your photos and pdf's.
8th, your contacts can be readily fed into the Net-Results database via csv imports, or by loading contacts in individually. The contact database includes an ability to readily create customized fields.
9th, any new update to the software becomes accessible to you. There is no tiered service. We all get to enjoy new features coming on stream.
What's amazing is this package is reasonably priced given all that is included.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Net-Results has created a standard of customer service that makes we wonder why other firms are still able to remain in business.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
My only mistake was thinking I needed Hubspot's online training to effectively become proficient in building marketing campaigns. Net-Results proved me wrong.

Less expensive systems cost less but leave a substantial gap in product quality and service offered by Net-Results. Net-Results pays for itself with a better representation of your business.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are creating highly customized campaigns for each of our B2B clients, that was not possible with a more expensive marketing database provider.
We are able to more readily see if campaigns are achieving their desired results.
Using the A/B testing tool, I can readily try out two different approaches to a campaign emailing, see their comparative performance, and have the system take over and apply the better campaign performance to the remainder of an outgoing email campaign.
We feel like we have an extra Marketing person on our team, using Net-Results

all_reviews.review_title: The Best Marketing Automation Solution For 95% Of Businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Great value for money, exceptional support, well thought through and well devised product that does everything that 95% of my clients need it to do. Very intuitive, incredibly easy to implement and a lot of added-value tools, reporting and features that one would normally only expect from one of the larger and more expensive platforms. In fact, compared to other platforms we use (or have used) like Hubspot and Act-On, it is in many ways far superior.

Hubspot for example is great with a lot of similar features but even things like building a drag and drop landing page or email are far more difficult/laborious on their platform than it is on Net-Results and they also charge for the data you host in the platform, not the data you use which, as an agency in particular, is punitive and very limiting. No such limitations with NR and the ability to flex the data is far superior to Hubspot. Act-On is probably the most comparable platform and I am still a big fan of them but, ultimately, I moved myself and my clients from them to Net-Results and I'm still happy with that decision.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
There's nothing I particularly dislike - any limitations of the platform are consistent with all other marketing automation tools in general, none of them do absolutely everything on your wishlist and they all have their nuances.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
As I said earlier, there is no sense in buying a Ferrari to do the school run. There are platforms out there who are fabulous at selling the dream but for 95% of businesses, the reality will be they pay a lot of money for a platform they only use 5% of. Better to pay a lot less and use 100% of Net-Results. For most of those clients, it is unlikely they will outgrow NR but even if they do, migration shouldn't be an issue.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're an agency who have been involved with marketing automation platform implementation and migration for over 5 years and have used most of the major platforms to one extent or another. We are a boutique content marketing agency and basically do everything social and digital so we need tools that allow us to fully orchestrate everything from SEO to PPC to social media to email to P2P and beyond. Net-Results has an excellent and flexible payment model that allows us to grow our agency and scale to fit the fluid needs and demands of our own customers. They allow us to implement rapidly and get our clients where they need to be easily and effectively. Although we'd class ourselves as power users, it's a really easy tool to learn and get to the stage where full value is being realised. There's no point buying a Ferrari to do the school run so beware expensive alternatives that are likely overkill for what your business really needs - Net-Results is the best solution for 95% clients and they certainly punch above their weight compared to even the so-called market leaders.

all_reviews.review_title: Net-Results: Get All the Help You Need
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
This was our company's first foray into the world of marketing automation, and we knew we were going to need a lot of help. We didn't want to be charged each time we needed help with something, so Net-Results was the best option out there, as they have unlimited support. We work with their support team on a daily basis, and I can tell you that not only are they incredibly responsive (there is no submitting a ticket - you just send an email or schedule or a call and you're set), but they're also incredibly helpful. We have learned so much about marketing automation by working with them.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Our biggest issue right now is not having custom objects available (this allows each contact to have more than one option listed under any field; i.e. items purchased). I know they're currently working on getting custom objects, but until then, we need to connect our marketing activities with revenue generated in a round-about way.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
If you're new to marketing automation, this is the company you should use. You will get all the help and support you need to make implementation and use successful.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Here's what I've been saying to my clients for last year about marketing automation in general-the activity surrounding it and the workload needs to rebranded to something else. Like 'centralized communication hub' or something more telling. That's not very sexy, I know.

The tool itself can facilitate and automate all sorts of customer communications.

This tool is more than just pinging your customer's inbox with offers. You could potentially set up all sorts of workflows that really elevate your CX (customer experience) from sales, marketing, customer service and transactional information.

It's a great tool. Not only for marketers but for anyone in business.

Also, N-R has the best customer service I have encountered with a tech firm.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
I have encountered integration issues with SalesForce.

The big issue is that SalesForce data is the foundation you use to build workflows. If this data isn't accurate or out-of-date it can trickle up to your campaigns.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
One thing I noticed when we incorporated marketing automation programs into client's company is that spurred a culture change internally. To some, this was the most valuable assets delivered by the product. It forced siloed departments to start working and thinking together. Pushing up

A lot of companies talk a big game about incorporating data-driven decision making into their marketing programs... Most don't.

A tool like N-R if leveraged correctly, can spur a culture change internal to any company. Because N-R uses data to create segments based on real data it can refocus internal teams dialogue on how to communicate with their various customer groups.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent product backed up by excellent support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Net-Results is an excellent marketing automation tool with very powerful segmentation capabilities. Segments can be used to drive analytics, workflows, campaigns, and more. The excellent product is backed up by a team that is responsive, knowledgeable, accessible, and friendly to work with.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Because of the amount of detail that's tracked in the system, querying for certain types of data can sometimes take a while for the server to respond. The insights the system provides, however, makes it worth the wait.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
We evaluated some of the more well-known products in the space and found Net-Results to be a much better fit for our needs. Also, we found Net-Results to be a very good culture fit for our company as we had great access to their executive team, their technology team when needed, and their excellent support staff. Other competitors may have a much larger footprint in terms of mind-share and awareness, but it was important for us to look beyond that to see the greater benefits we had with Net-Results' product and team. I'm definitely glad we did.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking for a system to manage lead nurturing and e-mail campaigns and manage contacts who were not ready for our sales funnel yet. As Net-Results continued to enhance the product, we've adopted more and more of its featureset, integrating it with our SFA, using it to build our forms and landing pages, and understand behavior of visitors as they went through the process of educating themselves about our market and our product. We've been able to run a very efficient marketing process partially due to the capabilities in Net-Results.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Not much. As with any SaaS product there is always a list of "likes" that would would love to see in the future, but net-Results says what it does on the box, and does it well.

If you are new to digital marketing automation and need lots of support, then I'd definitely recommend that you take a serious look at Net-Results. It's real power is the ability to segment your market into highly nuanced lists so that you can get exactly the right information to the right person.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to figure out, if new to marketing automation.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Responsiveness of support and willingness to listen to feedback.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Lack of flexibility in features.  Here are a few examples:  I can't turn a customer off on a particular drip, once they qualify...the only way to get them out is to make them qualify out.  I should have a manual kill switch on a particular campaign on a per-lead basis.

The integration you have with your email engine, doesn't match with the settings in my email campaigns that I have set up.  Even though I constrain emails to go out at a certain time, if there is a backlog of emails due to any one of your customers sending lots of emails, then my emails may actually go out outside of the constraints I set...this is bad.

Your form mapping tool is shaky at best.  I've tried using it several times and it seems to only receive data 50% of the time (this is for a form we already have that your application reads vs. creating a new form).

Your reporting within the campaigns doesn't allow you to constrain the results to certain dates.  For example, if I want to see how many emails went out within a certain campaign yesterday, then I have to download 85,000 emails in a .csv file to see that 1,000 of those went out yesterday.  Not ideal.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
If you need help, or believe something is missing, speak up.  The company seems very good at listening, and are very good at support.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We do a LOT less button pushing to keep in touch with our prospective and existing users.

all_reviews.review_title: It's a learning process for us and for Net Results.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Lead scoring, though we haven't fully started using that function yet. But I'm very excited for the potential.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
There are some barriers for us, as we use NR as a marketing tool, instead of a sales tool. Our CRM, Sugar, allows us to assign Leads vs. Opportunities to different teams/members, this prohibits us from being able to fully utilize some of the functions.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
This will be a great tool for you once you're able to fully understand all it has to offer. If you've worked within drip/nurturing campaigns, this should be a seamless transition. The team is readily on call for assistance, and while they may not know the answer, they're eager to work to find it for you. I'm confident that with a few more years under their belt, they're going to be a front runner.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've found great success in the ability to build out campaigns that auto-fire, eliminating extra steps/tasks for us as marketing managers. I've also found that the analytics we are able to pull from the campaigns are very useful. As I mentioned above, once we are fully immersed in the use of Lead Scoring, we will be able to take advantage of these analytics further.

all_reviews.review_title: New User on Trial Basis - A Very Good Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
I must begin this review by stating the following: I used Net-Results on a trial basis and chose to skip the training as I wanted to see how intuitive it was (though I did tap the customer support team a few times). Furthermore, I am a former Pardot user and I also did a trial of HubSpot and GreenRope. For the sake of simplicity, my comments are in bullet format.
*	Customer support - The customer support team blew me away; they were extremely helpful and responsive. They were also very open to feedback to improve the tool.
*	Sales process - not overly aggressive (unlike others) but very accommodating and responsive
*	Pricing - in comparison to other platforms and based on my budget, Net-Results offers the best overall value. They don't nickel and dime you for 'a la carte' features.
*	User interface - very intuitive for someone familiar with marketing automation but may require orientation for newbies
*	Dashboards - the right information, where you expect it, clear and easy to consume, and aesthetically pleasing
*	Reports- pulling reports was intuitive but I could not find a way to pull extensive user reports (this is most likely due to waiving the training)
*	Set-up - Initial set-up was very straight-forward and very fast and required very little IT support. Frankly, in comparing it to my Pardot experience, I'm at a loss as to why a consultant was required to set up Pardot and why it took over a month to get Pardot up and running.
*	Features - my use was limited to the below:
o	Email  & campaign builder - both were very easy to use and intuitive
o	Form builder - I did not build any standalone forms but I did link an existing contact form to Net-Results and was amazed at how easy it was to connect
*	Marketing automation workflows/trigger marketing and segmentation - while I did not use these features during my trial I did peruse them and found them to be more user-friendly than Pardot's drip marketing builder.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Tagging accounts from the daily website report was a bit tedious and could be streamlined to improve the process.
Reporting could also be streamlined

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ultimately, we are trying to do improve and streamline our marketing efforts and target prospects that are most engaged. Using the tool, even on a trial basis, we were able to achieve the following:
1) Gain insight into how prospects interact with the company and what marketing channels work best
2) Improve outreach efforts to what's most relevant to each prospect
3) Guide and refine marketing efforts based on how prospects interact

all_reviews.review_title: Great Product and Getting Better Backed By Great Support
all_reviews.review_content:

Very customizable. We use a very complicated CRM that was built in-house. We worked with Net-Results to integrate our CRM with Net-Results. This required some development on Net-Results end. We agreed they would have it done within a month and they got it done a week early!

Support is excellent and receptive. Constant new releases. It seems like every week a new feature is coming out so it keeps getting better.

For the price range, it's the most feature rich marketing automation solution.

There are ways to do this by the default "My contacts" view doesn't include when the contact was created, which would be nice along with having a search box instead of the filter for searching for contacts.

-	Lead scoring
-	Website visitor tracking

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Net-Results has a very simple to understand interface. Too simple, in a lot of ways. But simple nonetheless. By simple I mean that it's not overwhelming with features and unnecessary buttons and graphics.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Net-Results is very lacking in major marketing automation features. The automation part is a bit ironic as you have to do many things manually. The interface is simple at first glance but crucial features that are easy to find in most other marketing automation tools (Eloqua, Pardot, Marketo), you have to dig to find in NR.

I consider myself educated in marketing automation tools as I had used Eloqua and Pardot before using NR. But in using NR for 7 months, I contacted their support team about 20-30 times. Most of those times, it was to ask how something worked or where a certain feature was. It's just not intuitive at all.

Compared to Pardot and Eloqua, it's much more affordable (which is why my company went with it) but considering the number of times we had meetings about NR, how lacking it was, and how much time we were wasting using it versus our previous tool, it wasn't worth the savings.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
With marketing automation tools, we want to solve the problem of manually sending emails and manually nurturing prospects. These tools usually save teams a lot of time by automating the nurturing process. While NR does save time compared to accomplishing this manually, it causes a lot of headaches and does not live up to its much more user-friendly and robust competitors.

all_reviews.review_title: Net-Results is the most customizable marketing automation platform available.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
They worked closely with us to create APIs that automate list management. People are automatically added to lists based on their browsing activity.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Forms could be improved to include dependent fields. Campaign building could be simplified; branching and list selection is very complex. But it is very powerful.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Think outside the box. You can do more with this product than you might imagine.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We sell a very wide variety of machinery and equipment. We are constantly adding new items to our website and we need to know who is looking at them so that we can target market to them. Other companies would not provide customized solutions to automate the process of creating lists and adding people to them based on their activity. Using custom APIs, Net-Results built a solution for us that works seamlessly with our website and our product database. It's saving us a ton of time and allowing us to send follow-up emails within minutes of a visit. This is truly marketing automation.

all_reviews.review_title: Happy B2B Software Customer of Net Results
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
This is very powerful software, with great support, and it's easy to use. Plus, they were priced competitively versus similar companies, so it was a no-brainer.

I can't tell you how important good support is with MA software. No mater how much training you get, there will always be very nuanced questions relating to your exact work flow, and especially to how your Marketing and sales teams work together. And Net Results had detailed helpful answers within hours, every time.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Very few things. Most were my confusion on how the software worked and what it couldn't do.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Map out everything you want it to do before you start training. This includes how Sales should interact. It is very powerful.

Also, consider every way you can over-email people, and then work with NR to limit this as much as possible.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We get the following benefits:
- automated emails in a drip campaign that Sales can remove people from
- lead scoring and alerts that go right to the lead owner
- weekly reports to each Sales person with their hottest lead
- very finely tuned segments that can be used for alerts, emails, and scheduled reports
- integration with Salesforce. The Sales team can basically trigger their own emails

all_reviews.review_title: The best visitor tracking capabilities... period.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Net-Results offers the absolute best website visitor tracking of any marketing automation system I've used or demoed... and that includes the big pricey systems. It tracks all of the anonymous visitors to your site, showing you company names (when available), locations, pages viewed, time on each page, return visits and more. Our sales team reviews the anonymous visitor information each day. But the real power comes in when these visitors are identified--either by email clickthrough, webform completion, site login, or manual entry--and Net-Results reveals all of the previous visits for a once unknown visitor.  To know the interaction a prospect has had with your site before you ever knew their name is unprecedented sales insight.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
I would like to see greater reporting capabilities - the choices for emailing automated reports are somewhat limited, particularly with campaign-type reports.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Take the time to understand all of the features of this product and get them set up - don't expect that you are going to be able to jump right in and use everything all at once.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are now able to provide our sales team with more targeted leads, helping them to pinpoint top prospects and revealing what they are possibly interested in.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic support, super advanced segmenting, awesome CRM integration
all_reviews.review_content:

Net-Results has been an integral part of our marketing strategy for 2 years now. The platform is user friendly, self explanatory, and can be VERY powerful. But the best thing about them is their support, which is all US based, and you get a PERSON on the phone whenever you call. The Sugar integration is fantastic too. You can't lose with NR!

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
The Net-Results landing page builder isn't the best. Thankfully, they have an integration with Unbounce, which is the best landing page builder in the world, so that's not the worst thing.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
Syncing our lists from Sugar to a marketing platform was not easy before Net-Results. We want to communicate EASILY and in an organized fashion with our prospects and customers. NR makes that a breeze. You can also put new calls to action and new email campaigns out QUICKLY. Which means we're more efficient and successful.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Net-Results?
review_question_answers.answer: Net-Results has been an integral part of our marketing strategy for 2 years now. The platform is user friendly, self explanatory, and can be VERY powerful. But the best thing about them is their support, which is all US based, and you get a PERSON on the phone whenever you call. The Sugar integration is fantastic too. You can't lose with NR!

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Net-Results?
review_question_answers.answer: The Net-Results landing page builder isn't the best. Thankfully, they have an integration with Unbounce, which is the best landing page builder in the world, so that's not the worst thing.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Syncing our lists from Sugar to a marketing platform was not easy before Net-Results. We want to communicate EASILY and in an organized fashion with our prospects and customers. NR makes that a breeze. You can also put new calls to action and new email campaigns out QUICKLY. Which means we're more efficient and successful.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent customer service and value of product.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Their customer service is outstanding! Anytime I need assistance they are willing to offer advice or provide "how to" on a function. Net-Results goes above and beyond to help integrate into existing platforms and migrate from another platform. The platform is extremely user friendly and does not require coding knowledge to operate. You also receive a lot of information about visitors, leads, and contacts.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
Folder organization is not available within all of the different platform sections. Inability to integrate social media toolbars. Assets and images are not housed in the same place.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Definitely give Net-Results a call. Many of the larger Marketing Automation companies have forgotten about the small/medium size business needs.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am able to see a great deal of information about our site visitors, leads and customers to better predict the needs of our market. Seamless integration with SFDC and our website. Being able to know where leads are coming from and what the specific referral source is phenomenal.

all_reviews.review_title: Flexible and Powerful Marketing Automation in One Package
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Net-Results allows me to design automated campaigns with an infinite amount of scoring and structural options. I can run a timely drip campaign while in the same instance put together a complex nurture campaign and pull a report of our hottest leads. The ability to score and design as I wish is key to our agency providing turnkey automation services to clients. Also, I cannot brag enough about the service and support we get from Net-Results. They make it simple for me as an agency to operate and sell in.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
The adoption of social media and digital media tracking seems lacking. More functionality here would be nice.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Take the time to understand how to do business together with Net-Results.

What problems is Net-Results solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are increasing focus on sales-ready leads in a timely manner. We are reducing the amount of time it takes to acquire, nurture and convert leads. We are optimizing our acquisition activities to those that perform the best, therefore eliminating wasted dollars.

What do you like best about Net-Results?
I like how Net-Results is set up for a partnership model. They are invested in the success of their Agency Partners and are committed to helping us know the platform inside and out.

I've done demos from lots of different solutions, each has their pros and cons. A lot of the others look "slicker" but lack the power of Net-Results.  The "Segment" Approach is brilliant. No other marketing automation engine uses this approach (to my knowledge).

The pricing can't be beat either. It's simply the best around.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
I wish the Agency program had single sign-on for all of the client accounts. I have to create separate emails for each customer account as I am administrating most of the campaigns. (Our clients typically would rather have us take care of everything then worry about managing it themselves).

The email engine works great for transactional emails and true "automation campaigns", its not well suited for large "one-off" email blasts. It works, it just takes a little longer to get them all out than some of the more powerful ESP's I've used. I also don't like how you are unable to change the "from" email address, or customize the unsubscribe language in the footer.

I also wish that there were more social integrations and that the tool used social profile data, etc like some of the other MA providers, but I am told this is happening in the future.

It's a little slow when handling massive e-blasts. I often run campaigns for a client that has a list size of about 70,000k records.  I run them through net-results for convenience, but always make sure to have the campaign start about an hour or so before I want the first email to get delivered as it takes a little longer for emails to get sent out. I also do not like how you are not able to change the "from email", or customize the unsubscribe footer on the emails.

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
Net-results has an open API, (other providers charge a premium for this). With a little work, you can integrate the system into legacy CRM systems or other data sources to create a system that works for you, or in my case, your clients.

all_reviews.review_title: Net Results is a good tool for email campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Net-Results?
Customer service. Anytime I needed something customized or personalized, I was able to call up the customer service team and they were able to either walk me through what I needed done or actually create it for me to save me some time.

I had a very unusual request for them that was going to require me to spend hours if not days to complete. They gladly took the time to go to their development team and figure out a way to make it as easy as possible for me, the customer. That really sat well with me that they would take the time to make me happy and keep my customers happy.

In terms of deploying emails, it was pretty simple and straightforward. Go in, follow the wizard and your campaigns are sent.
Reporting is pretty good and gets you all your basic open rates, click rates, bounces all real time which is nice as I constantly like to go in and see if people are clicking my campaigns right after I deploy them.

What do you dislike about Net-Results?
The two biggest negatives were:
1) I am on ET and they operate out of MT so were a few hours behind. If i needed to get some technical assistance, I would have to wait a few hours to get a hold of them. On the contrary, when I had the 6/7 o'clock email panic, they were there to answer phone calls and help me get what I needed quickly.

2) It was difficult to pull lists that were over 50k without having the system time out. What I had to do was call Net Results to do the pull for me. Sometimes I would have a request for this first thing in the morning my time and I wouldn't be able to get it until they opened at 10:30 my time

Recommendations to others considering Net-Results:
It's a great tool for email campaign management and marketing automation, especially if your list sizes are less than 50K. I think that they are growing and definitely headed in the right direction as well.
